documents.t: FinSim Pro is a powerful financial simulation tool designed to help you visualize and forecast your financial future with precision and ease.
Understanding the underlying data structures can help when working with advanced features or contributing to the project.
FinSim Pro leverages several powerful libraries. This section provides reference documentation for the key APIs used in the project.
This section documents the core data structures used in FinSim Pro.
FinSim Pro is built as a modern React application, leveraging client-side calculation for instant feedback.
FinSim Pro supports multiple accounts, allowing you to model your entire financial portfolio in one place.
The Financial Chart is the central visualization tool in FinSim Pro. It displays your projected account balance over time, allowing you to spot trends, deficits, and growth opportunities.
FinSim Pro goes beyond simple income and expenses by supporting Formulas. These allow you to model complex financial behaviors like compound interest, inflation, or variable rates.
The Event Timeline allows you to manage all your financial events—Income, Expenses, and Transfers. It provides a chronological view of what's affecting your balance.
FinSim Pro allows you to model your financial future by adding Events (Income, Expenses) and Effects (Interest).
Once you've set up your simulation, it's time to analyze the data to make better financial decisions.
Events are the building blocks of your simulation. They represent money moving in or out of your accounts.
In this tutorial, we will build a simple financial simulation to model a savings goal.
Interest effects allow you to model growth (like investments) or debt (like loans) that compound over time.
The interactive chart is the heart of FinSim Pro. It visualizes your projected balance over time based on your defined events.
FinSim Pro is a powerful financial simulation tool designed to help you visualize and forecast your financial future with precision and ease.

FinSim Pro allows you to model complex financial scenarios by defining accounts, income sources, expenses, and compounding effects. With its interactive timeline and real-time charting, you can instantly see how today's decisions impact your financial trajectory over the next 5 years.

Interactive Chart Visualize your balance history and future projections with a responsive, zoomable area chart. Event Timeline Drag-and-drop interface to manage income, expenses, and transfers. Toggle events to test scenarios. Smart Formulas Apply complex interest effects and recurring adjustments with built-in formula support.
Ready to start planning? Start the Tutorials →
Understanding the underlying data structures can help when working with advanced features or contributing to the project.

Represents a financial container (e.g., Checking, Savings). interface Account { id: string; name: string; type: 'checking' | 'savings' | 'investment' | 'credit'; initialBalance: number; interestRate: number; // APY color: string; }

Represents a single income or expense rule. interface FinancialItem { id: string; accountId: string; name: string; amount: number; type: 'income' | 'expense' | 'transfer'; frequency: 'once' | 'daily' | 'weekly' | 'monthly' | 'yearly'; startDate: Date; endDate?: Date; isEnabled: boolean; }

A single data point on the chart, representing the state at a specific time. interface SimulationPoint { date: string; // ISO Date string balance: number; events: string[]; // IDs of events that occurred on this day }
FinSim Pro leverages several powerful libraries. This section provides reference documentation for the key APIs used in the project.
Coming Soon: Swagger UI for internal API testing.
We use TradingView's Lightweight Charts for financial visualization. Official Documentation API Reference
Used for drag-and-drop interactions in the timeline. Documentation
Used for the icon set. Icon Library
This section documents the core data structures used in FinSim Pro.
Represents a financial account (e.g., Checking, Savings). export interface Account { id: string; name: string; initialBalance: number; }

Represents an event or effect that modifies the account balance (Income, Expense, Transfer, Interest). export interface FinancialItem { id: string; accountId: string; // The "owner" account toAccountId?: string; // For transfers name: string; startDate: string; // YYYY-MM-DD endDate?: string; // YYYY-MM-DD type: 'income' | 'expense' | 'transfer' | 'effect'; amount?: number; formula: FormulaType; isEnabled?: boolean; // Recurring specifics recurrenceDays?: number; // "Every X Days" // Effect specifics (Interest) interestRate?: number; // % compoundingPeriod?: CompoundingPeriod; }
Represents a single data point in the calculated simulation timeline. export interface SimulationPoint { date: string; balance: number; }
Granularity of the chart view. export enum Frequency { DAILY = 'DAILY', WEEKLY = 'WEEKLY', MONTHLY = 'MONTHLY', QUARTERLY = 'QUARTERLY', YEARLY = 'YEARLY' }

Calculation method for the item. export enum FormulaType { LUMP_SUM = 'LUMP_SUM', MONTHLY_SUM = 'MONTHLY_SUM', RECURRING_SUM = 'RECURRING_SUM', COMPOUNDING = 'COMPOUNDING', SIMPLE_INTEREST = 'SIMPLE_INTEREST' }
FinSim Pro is built as a modern React application, leveraging client-side calculation for instant feedback.

Frontend Framework: React 18+ (Vite) Language: TypeScript State Management: React Context + Hooks Styling: Tailwind CSS Charting: Lightweight Charts (TradingView) Icons: Lucide React Drag & Drop: @dnd-kit

The core logic resides in useSimulation.ts. It: Takes the initial state (Accounts, Events). Iterates through each day of the simulation range. Applies recurring events (Income/Expenses). Calculates interest and formula effects. Generates a SimulationPoint array for the chart.

The TimelineSyncChart component ensures that the visual timeline of events aligns perfectly with the main financial chart. It shares the same X-axis (Time) scale, allowing for synchronized zooming and panning.
Represents a financial container. id: Unique identifier (UUID). name: Display name (e.g., "Checking"). initialBalance: Starting funds (currently defaulted to 0).

The central entity representing any financial event or rule. Core Fields: id: UUID. accountId: The account this item belongs to. type: 'income' | 'expense' | 'transfer' | 'effect'. name: Display label. amount: The base value (for non-effect types). startDate: When the item becomes active. isEnabled: Toggle for including/excluding in simulation. order: Integer for controlling calculation sequence (drag-and-drop). Logic Configuration: formula: Determines how the item behaves (LUMP_SUM, RECURRING_SUM, COMPOUNDING, etc.). recurrenceDays: Interval in days for recurring items. interestRate: Percentage for effects (e.g., 5.0 for 5%). compoundingPeriod: Base interval for interest calculation (DAILY, MONTHLY, etc.).

A single data point in the calculated time series. date: ISO date string. balance: The final calculated balance for this date. balanceBeforeEffects: Snapshot of balance before interest/effects ran for this day. itemStartBalances: A map (Record<string, number>) tracking the balance state immediately before a specific item was applied. Used for accurate "Principal" display in the UI.
LUMP_SUM: One-time event. MONTHLY_SUM: Standard monthly recurrence (legacy/simplified). RECURRING_SUM: Flexible recurrence (every X days). COMPOUNDING: Interest calculation.
Used for chart granularity (DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY, etc.).
FinSim Pro supports multiple accounts, allowing you to model your entire financial portfolio in one place.
Click the + button next to the account tabs at the bottom of the screen. Enter a name for the new account (e.g., "Savings", "Investment"). The new account starts with a $0 balance.
Click on the tabs at the bottom left to switch between accounts. Each account has its own independent: Starting Balance Events (Income/Expenses) Simulation Chart
In the sidebar, you can: Rename: Click the account name to edit it. Initial Balance: Set the starting amount for the account. Interest Rate: Set a base APY (Annual Percentage Yield) for the account.
Click the Trash icon in the sidebar to delete the currently selected account. Warning: This action cannot be undone.
The Financial Chart is the central visualization tool in FinSim Pro. It displays your projected account balance over time, allowing you to spot trends, deficits, and growth opportunities.

Zoom In/Out: Use the + and - buttons in the chart header. Mouse Wheel Zoom: Hold Ctrl (or Cmd on Mac) and scroll with your mouse wheel to zoom in and out. Pan: Click and drag anywhere on the chart area to move back and forth in time.

Switch between different views to analyze your finances at different scales: Daily: View day-by-day balance changes. Weekly: Good for short-term planning. Monthly: Ideal for budgeting and bill tracking. Quarterly: Spot seasonal trends. Yearly: Long-term wealth projection.

The chart displays two vertical green dashed lines: Simulation Start: The current date (or your custom start date). Simulation End: The end of the projection period (default is 5 years). Events outside this range are not calculated or displayed.
Hover over any point on the chart to see: Date: The specific date under your cursor. Balance: The exact projected balance for that date.
FinSim Pro goes beyond simple income and expenses by supporting Formulas. These allow you to model complex financial behaviors like compound interest, inflation, or variable rates.

Applies a percentage growth to the account balance. Rate: The annual interest rate (e.g., 5%). Compounding: How often interest is applied (Monthly, Yearly, Daily). Example: A savings account with 5% APY compounding monthly.
Applies interest based only on the principal amount (not including previously earned interest).

For advanced users, you can write custom mathematical expressions using variables. Available Variables: b = Current Balance t = Time (days since start) d = Day of month m = Month (1-12) Example: b * 0.05 / 12 (Apply 5% annual interest monthly)
Click the Flip icon in the timeline header to switch to Formula View. This view visualizes the mathematical effects being applied to your balance over time, rather than just the cash flow events.
The Event Timeline allows you to manage all your financial events—Income, Expenses, and Transfers. It provides a chronological view of what's affecting your balance.
Click the + Add Income or + Add Expense buttons in the sidebar to create a new event.
Click on any event bar in the timeline to open the editor in the sidebar. You can change: Name Amount Frequency Start/End Dates
You can drag events directly on the timeline to reschedule them. Move: Drag the center of the bar to move the entire event. Resize: Drag the edges of the bar to change the Start or End date.

The timeline includes a Zoom Tracking toggle in the header (next to the Flip icon). Enabled (Purple): The timeline view syncs with the Chart's zoom level. Disabled (Green): The timeline shows the full simulation range, regardless of the chart's zoom.
Use the Filter button to show only specific types of events: All Events Income Only Expenses Only Variable (Formulas)

FinSim Pro is a financial simulation application designed to help users visualize and forecast their financial future. It allows users to model various financial scenarios by defining accounts, income sources, expenses, and compounding effects over time.

Financial Simulation: Projects daily balances up to 5 years into the future based on user-defined events. Interactive Chart: A responsive area chart (using Recharts) visualizing the projected balance over time. Event Timeline: A drag-and-drop timeline interface for managing financial events (income, expenses, effects). Compounding Effects: Supports complex financial logic like compound interest, inflation, or recurring adjustments. Scenario Management: Users can toggle events on/off to see how different decisions impact their financial trajectory. Data Persistence: Supports exporting and importing simulation data via JSON.

Accounts: Containers for funds (e.g., Checking, Savings). Items (Events): Discrete financial actions: Income: Adds to balance (e.g., Salary). Expense: Subtracts from balance (e.g., Rent). Effect: Modifies balance based on formulas (e.g., 5% annual interest). Simulation Engine: A deterministic engine that calculates daily balances by applying all active items in chronological order.
Initial Release Interactive Financial Chart Event Timeline with Drag-and-Drop Multiple Accounts Support Custom Formulas & Interest Effects Dark Mode UI
Beta testing release Basic chart functionality Simple income/expense tracking
FinSim Pro allows you to model your financial future by adding Events (Income, Expenses) and Effects (Interest).

Select an Account: Ensure the correct account is selected in the sidebar (e.g., "Checking"). Click "Add Income" or "Add Expense": Located in the sidebar. Configure the Event: Name: Give it a descriptive name (e.g., "Salary"). Amount: Enter the value. Frequency: Choose how often it occurs (One-time, Monthly, Recurring). Dates: Set the Start and End dates. Save: Click the checkmark icon to save.
Income: Adds to your balance. Expense: Subtracts from your balance. Transfer: Moves money between accounts. Interest Effect: Applies a percentage growth (or loss) over time.
Once you've set up your simulation, it's time to analyze the data to make better financial decisions.
Upward Slope: Your wealth is growing. You are saving more than you spend. Downward Slope: You are burning cash. Your expenses exceed your income. Flat Line: You are breaking even.
Look for dips in the chart. Below Zero: If the line crosses below $0, you will run out of money. Recovery: How long does it take to recover from a large expense?

The timeline is interactive. You can toggle events on and off to see their impact. Scenario: "Can I afford this vacation?" Create a "Vacation" expense event. Toggle it ON. Does your balance stay above zero? Toggle it OFF to compare.

Enable Zoom Tracking (purple toggle) to focus the timeline on a specific period. Zoom the chart into a specific month. The timeline will update to show only the events happening in that month. This helps you see exactly which bills are due during a low-cash period.
Events are the building blocks of your simulation. They represent money moving in or out of your accounts.
Adds money to your account. Examples: Salary, Freelance work, Dividends, Gifts.
Removes money from your account. Examples: Rent, Groceries, Subscriptions, One-time purchases.
Moves money from one account to another. Examples: Transferring to Savings, Paying off Credit Card.

When creating an event, you can choose how often it repeats: Frequency Description One-time Happens once on a specific date. Daily Repeats every day. Weekly Repeats every week (e.g., every Friday). Bi-weekly Repeats every 2 weeks. Monthly Repeats on the same day each month. Yearly Repeats once a year (e.g., Birthday money).
You can set a Start Date and an End Date for recurring events. Example: A car loan payment that lasts for 3 years. Set the End Date to 3 years from now, and the expense will stop automatically.
In this tutorial, we will build a simple financial simulation to model a savings goal.
We want to see if we can save $10,000 in one year.
FinSim Pro installed and running. A default "Checking" account (or create a new one).
Click on the "Checking" account in the sidebar. Set the Initial Balance to $1,000 (your current savings).
Click + Add Income. Name: "Job". Amount: $3,000. Frequency: "Monthly". Start Date: Today. Click Save.
Click + Add Expense. Name: "Rent & Bills". Amount: $2,000. Frequency: "Monthly". Click Save.
Let's say you plan to buy a laptop in 6 months. Click + Add Expense. Name: "Laptop". Amount: $1,500. Frequency: "One-time". Date: Select a date 6 months from now. Click Save.

Look at the chart. Hover over the date exactly one year from now. What is the balance? Calculation: Starting: $1,000 Net Monthly: 3,000−3,000 - 3,000−2,000 = $1,000 12 Months: 1,000∗12=1,000 * 12 = 1,000∗12=12,000 Laptop: -$1,500 Total: 1,000+1,000 + 1,000+12,000 - 1,500=∗∗1,500 = **1,500=∗∗11,500** 🎉 Success! You reached your goal of $10,000.
Interest effects allow you to model growth (like investments) or debt (like loans) that compound over time.
Let's model a savings account with a 4.5% APY.
Create a new account named "HYSA". Set Initial Balance to $5,000.
In the sidebar, look for the Interest / Formula section (or toggle to Formula View). Click + Add Formula. Type: "Compound Interest". Rate: 4.5%. Compounding: "Monthly". Click Save.
Look at the chart. Unlike the straight lines of simple income/expenses, you should see a slight upward curve. This is the power of compound interest!

For more complex scenarios, you can write custom math expressions. Example: Inflation Adjustment To model expenses increasing by 3% inflation each year: amount * (1.03 ^ (years)) (Note: Custom formula editor is an advanced feature enabled in settings)
The interactive chart is the heart of FinSim Pro. It visualizes your projected balance over time based on your defined events.
Zoom: Use the + / - buttons in the header, or scroll with your mouse wheel while holding Ctrl/Cmd. Pan: Click and drag the chart to move through time.
Switch between Daily, Weekly, Monthly, Quarterly, and Yearly views using the buttons in the top-left.
The green dashed lines indicate the Simulation Start and End dates. Events outside this range are not calculated.
Hover over the chart to see the exact balance and date at any point.
